page.title: 02 RELIGION ST.TERESA'S CHURCH
page.content: We live in Penwortham,and our local Catholic church is St.Teresa's.Since 1933 there have been 2 churches,the oldest has been converted into a parish hall.Before the churches were built our parishioners went to mass at St. Wilfreds(Preston) or to St.Mary Magdalene's(Penwortham) St.Teresa's became a parish in 1959 and since then has grown tremendously. Most of our class attend mass here and the youth club,which is organised by the church,is popular with the All Hallows pupils. The church organises a wide variety of clubs for all ages,including charity groups,sports clubs,and choirs.The junior choir has 25 members and is conducted by Mrs.C.Alexander.A few of the pupils at this school sing at the most popular mass-9.20am,on Sundays for the choir.
